page.title: 18ALRESFORD MARKET
page.content: In the 14th. Century Alresford was an important wool centre and market. These eventually became the market in Broad St. where there were open stalls for meat, fish and farm produce. Every Thursday the market scene returns and the town is even more busy and alive. Today the stalls are very similar to those of 200 years ago the people still bustle about examining the goods for sale.The live stock is missing but there is still the atmosphere of the rural market town. Farm produce is fresh and plants for sale are strong and cared for.A clay pottery stall caters for the County Set while a clothes seller provides a service to all those seeking a bargain. Crockery and Books are eagerly sifted and purchases made. The market gives soul to the life of the town.
